positionName: ANALISTA DE ENGENHARIA ( Desenvolvedor de embarcados)
descriptionHTML:
A Komeco é uma marca brasileira 100% capital nacional e, há mais de 30 anos, desenvolve produtos com soluções tecnológicas pensando no conforto, bem-estar e sustentabilidade de seus consumidores.

Localizada na cidade de Palhoça, no Estado de Santa Catarina, a Komeco atua no ramo de aquecimento solar de água, aquecimento a gás, bombas e pressurizadores, geração de energia solar fotovoltaica, equipamentos para aquecimento e tratamento de água para piscinas e climatização como condicionadores, desumidificadores e umidificadores de ar.

Você é apaixonado por tecnologia e busca um desafio emocionante no mundo dos sistemas embarcados? Estamos procurando um Analista de Desenvolvimento de Embarcados para se juntar à nossa equipe inovadora! Se você possui habilidades em programação e um entendimento profundo de hardware, esta pode ser a oportunidade perfeita para você.

O que você vai fazer:
Desenvolver Hardware: Criar projetos eletrônicos (PCB, PCBAs), esquemas elétricos e prototipar circuitos eletrônicos;

Desenvolver Firmwares: Criar firmwares para microcontroladores e microprocessadores, utilizando linguagens como C/C++, Python e Java/C#.

Colaboração Criativa : Trabalhar junto a uma equipe dinâmica para desenhar sistemas embarcados e definir requisitos de hardware e software que façam a diferença.

Integração de Hardware e Software: Realize testes e depurações em ambientes reais, garantindo que tudo funcione como deveria.

Inovação Contínua: Participe do desenvolvimento de novos produtos e melhorias, colaborando ativamente com equipes de engenharia.

Testes e Validações: Teste e valide sistemas embarcados, identificando e solucionando bugs para garantir um funcionamento impecável.

Documentação : Mantenha uma documentação clara e completa, respeitando normas e boas práticas do setor.

O que você precisa ter:
Experiencia na utilização de simuladores (LTspice, Proteus, Multisim);

Domínio sobre dimensionamento de componentes;

Domínio sobre fontes de alimentação e reguladores;

Operar softwares: KiCad, Eagle, Altium Designer;

Domínio sobre Layout físico, roteamento de trilhas;

Experiência com sinal de alta frequência, ruído, interferência eletromagnética (EMI/ EMC);

Programação em Linguagens C/C++;

Familiaridade com arquiteturas como NXP, ESP32, STM32, etc.;

Leitura e escrita em GPIOs, I2C, SPI, UART, CAN, ADC/DAC, etc.;

Experiência com sistemas operacionais como FreeRTOS, Zephyr, RTEMS, VxWorks, ou outros;

Desejável em criação e manutenção de firmwares confiáveis e atualizações OTA;

Familiarizado com protocolos industriais (Modbus, CANopen, MQTT, etc.);

Integração com redes, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee, LoRa, etc.;

Experiência com comunicação entre sistemas embarcados e aplicações em Python, Java, ou aplicativos mobile/IoT.

Se você está pronto para fazer parte de uma equipe que valoriza a inovação e a colaboração, e se você deseja impactar diretamente a criação de produtos tecnológicos de ponta, queremos conhecer você! Venha crescer e brilhar conosco!

description:
All roles at JumpCloud are Remote unless otherwise specified in the Job Description.

About JumpCloud
JumpCloud® delivers a unified open directory platform that makes it easy to securely manage identities, devices, and access across your organization. With JumpCloud, IT teams and MSPs enable users to work securely from anywhere and manage their Windows, Apple, Linux, and Android devices from a single platform. JumpCloud is IT Simplified.

About the Role
The Senior Data Engineer will have a crucial role on the Enterprise Data and Analytics (EDA) team, an internal, cross-functional analytics team that supports stakeholders across all company’s business units, including Finance, Marketing, Sales, Growth, UX, Customer Success, and Product. The primary responsibility of this role is to drive JumpCloud’s core reporting by developing data pipelines, curating and modeling data, and designing databases to enable insights and self-service across the analytics team and organization.

The Senior Data Engineer will collaborate with analytics teams (EDA, embedded analysts), technical teams (Enterprise Support Systems, Platform Engineering, Software Engineering), and business stakeholders to develop and maintain data pipelines, curated data models, and database designs that will support business and analytics insights throughout the organization.

The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about data and continuous improvement. They will have the ability to balance and prioritize multiple projects, ask insightful questions in an ambiguous environment, and coordinate execution across various stakeholders. A proactive and hands-on approach is essential, as JumpCloud is a lean and fast-moving company.

What you’ll be doing:
Driving large, impactful projects involving data pipelines, database design, data modeling, and data curation for optimized analytics and business use with involvement across various stakeholders, business units, and technical partners.

The Joinville Manufacturing Operations Director is responsible for the end-to-end process for the Manufacturing Technology Solutions Division at the Joinville site. This leader provides direction to the cross-functional team to ensure the reliability of quality identifiers. To achieve and ensure all requirements related to Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS), Quality, Financial, and Capex, the director ensures alignment with the expectations of our company and the global team.

The director plays a key role in developing and executing the site’s strategic priorities and actively sponsors a culture of continuous improvement, while leveraging Diversity and Inclusion as core values.

Main Responsibilities:

Ensure compliance within the region according to company trade standards and policies at manufacturing sites.
Support trade compliance audits at the site to ensure adherence to policies and procedures and assist in developing and implementing corrective and preventive actions.
Frequently interact with other Marketing, Sales, and R&D departments within the region.
Lead the integration between the site of Joinville Technology Solutions and the company global Manufacturing Division.
Set the overall plant strategy, including developing a 5-year plan to optimize site activity and performance.
Collaborate with your team to evaluate and continuously improve the plant's Environmental, Health, and safety compliance posture. You will strive to provide all employees with a safe and healthy workplace.
Organize manufacturing activities to ensure an uninterrupted supply of products at a competitive cost. You will collaborate with the site leadership teams to ensure accurate reporting.
Responsible for the Product Quality delivered in your scope. You will provide the necessary evidence and documentation to keep products compliant with various global and national regulations related to these kinds of products. You will ensure that the Quality organization follows the Global Quality strategy.
Promote the creation of the right manufacturing performance tracking tools (incl. the right Key Performance Indicators) and use these tools to evaluate the performance of the manufacturing sites.
Promote Lean Manufacturing & 6 Sigma principles in the manufacturing facilities. You will sponsor the Continuous improvement & best practice sharing initiatives.
Co-define and execute a mid-long and long-term strategy for its manufacturing sites to cope with the targeted growth and the unpredictability of some markets.
Provide ongoing feedback and sponsor development opportunities to your Leadership Team, explicitly focusing on the talent and expertise pool.
You will frequently interact with the other Marketing/Sales and R&D departments in their Region.

Master’s degree in engineering or equivalent.
Proven relevant work experience.
Advanced/Fluent in English

Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing principles.
Familiarity with Six Sigma principles

Successfully collaborates across functions and geographies, with extensive experience in driving cross-functional processes and a career progression showing multifunctional growth.
Demonstrates creativity and effectiveness in addressing strategic challenges, possessing an entrepreneurial mindset capable of thinking outside the box and taking measured risks. Insightful about how Supply Chain capabilities can enable commercial success and drive multinational growth.
A strong, inspirational, and enterprise leader with a hands-on, high-energy, action-oriented style. Establishes clear expectations and priorities, drives key initiatives to completion, takes decisive action, and holds accountability for decisions. Sets goals, consistently delivers plans, monitors progress, and proactively addresses issues. Exhibits flexible and creative problem-solving skills with a strong personal work ethic.
Willing to challenge conventional thinking and the status quo, driving organizational change that results in the consistent delivery of high-quality results.
A world-class team player who works effectively in a team-based organization, collaborates cross-functionally, influences at senior levels, and builds alignment around goals and objectives.
Demonstrates conviction by staking out a position and setting a clear course of action while building consensus on key initiatives and priorities. Resolves organizational issues through difficult decisions that ensure the success of the business strategy and proactively confronts problems or conflicts across teams or divisions.
Capable of simplifying and conveying complex concepts and strategies, both orally and in writing. Effectively conducts and facilitates meetings, possesses strong presentation skills, and is an excellent listener who seeks broad input and feedback with frequent follow-up. An articulate and dynamic communicator across multiple audiences.
Demonstrates effective performance management by holding direct reports accountable and ensuring outcomes are followed by appropriate consequences. Champions leadership development initiatives that contribute to a strong, diverse succession pool.
Shows that attracting, selecting, and retaining top diverse talent is critical to long-term business success. Identifies future talent requirements and develops strong workforce plans.
Proven ability to lead key initiatives, motivating teams to work collaboratively to achieve objectives and maintain organizational focus on key priorities. Provides clear direction, delegates effectively, and actively communicates with superior project and people management skills.
Possesses a good understanding of the technical discipline of Manufacturing operations, applying its principles and methods to support business strategy and drive operational improvements for competitive advantage.
Exhibits unquestioned integrity and strong business ethics, demonstrating a firm commitment to the company’s culture and values. Holds an industry reputation and record of achievement that establishes trust and credibility with peers, subordinates, collaboration partners, and external constituents.
Understands, integrates, and resolves different customer demands.
Executes duties with focus, drive, competitiveness, urgency, and a need to win

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it.

Darkroom is a vertically integrated digital agency pioneering the next generation of consumer-facing brands. A category leader in results-driven growth marketing, Darkroom’s success is attributed to our unique partnership model, purposefully built to launch brands to market and accelerate growth across direct-to-consumer. Our model is predicated on three major partnership structures — Growth & Scaling, Digital Platforms, and Brand & Product Launches – threaded by one cohesive, interdisciplinary team.

Taking the startup mindset to the agency space, the collective expertise of our team of entrepreneurs and senior digital marketers are deeply aware of the newest trends in e-commerce, development, and digital marketing. Our learned experience has allowed us to take clients (and internal ventures) from $0 to millions in revenue in just a few months. We work with game-changing brands: Crate & Barrel, Popchips, FEED, Olipop, & CALPAK, to name a few.

What you’ll do:

Lead and mentor the data engineering team, fostering technical growth and collaboration

Architect, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and infrastructure (Google Cloud preferred)

Manage and build new technical data products for client reporting and cross-departmental collaboration.

Maintain and improve existing our existing client data infrastructure and reporting product, the Flight Plan.

Design and implement data models, ETL processes, microservices, and data warehousing solutions

Ensure data quality, governance, and security best practices across all platforms

Optimize data processing for performance, reliability, and cost-effectiveness

Use AI and automation to optimize data engineering workflows

Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders to deliver robust data and AI solutions

Oversee data integration from multiple internal and external sources

Recruit, onboard, and develop top data engineering talent

Monitor and report on data platform health, performance, and KPIs

Stay current with industry trends to guide long-term data strategy and innovation

You should apply if this sounds like you:

Experience

7+ years building and scaling data pipelines in complex environments

Proficient in Python and modern data engineering frameworks

Strong experience with cloud platforms (Google Cloud preferred)

Proven track record in architecting and optimizing ETL processes and data warehouses

Experience leading and mentoring data engineering teams

Familiarity with data governance, security, and compliance best practices

Experience in the advertising or marketing industry is a plus

Excellent collaboration skills with cross-functional technical and business teams

What its like to work at Darkroom:

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it. We only seek out the best—from our clients to our people. Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks:

Darkweek, Unlimited Vacation Policy, and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, our annual “Darkweek” summer break, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp.

Darkroom offers a Phantom Equity Incentive Plan—a long-term, seniority-based cash bonus that vests over five years and pays out if the company is sold, rewarding those who help us grow.

Finances, growth, and retirement: After one year with Darkroom, we deliver a robust 401k program with company match, equity incentives, and a profit-sharing opportunity so we can help you save as the company grows.

Endless opportunities for growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

positionName: PDI Technician in Itajai, Santa Catarina, Brazil
description:
1. Carry out the Pre-Delivery Inspection for new inbound machines, stored machines, and outbound shipments. This includes exterior and interior damage inspections, component and accessory reviews, handling damage claims, software, and language adjustments.

2. Create detailed reports and identify trends for issues discovered during the pre-delivery inspection process.

3. Conduct root-cause analysis and collaborate extensively with quality, production, and engineering departments to address issues found during PDI.

4. Maintain accurate records of new machines arrivals and machines that have completed the PDI process to prepare them for delivery.

5. Take corrective actions for on-hold machines and ensuring they are ready for delivery on time.

6.Loading and unloading goods from trucks and containers.

7.Organizing and maintaining the storage areas to ensure efficient flow of materials.

8.Picking, packing, and preparing orders for shipment.

9.Conducting regular inventory counts and reporting discrepancies.

10.Maintaining a clean and orderly workspace, adhering to health and safety guidelines.

11.Assisting with the receipt of incoming shipments and inspecting for damage.

12.Collaborating with other team members to support daily warehouse operations.

13.Operating warehouse equipment, such as forklifts, as necessary.

Requirements

1. AWP/MEWP Industry Experience will be preferred

2. Good working knowledge of mobile elevating work platforms engineering, with ideally 2 Year Minimum in heavy equipment maintenance

3. Have work rights with no restriction in Brazil

4. Have a friendly, can-do attitude

5. Team orientated and a confident communicator

6. Good attention to detail

description:
Você quer fazer parte de um grande time em uma empresa que não para de crescer?

Se você gosta de desafios, é comunicativo, gosta de interagir com pessoas e busca crescimento, não pode perder essa oportunidade, nós queremos nos conectar com você!

Então, vem participar do nosso processo seletivo para Atendente de loja na Panvel.

Valorizamos a diversidade e inovação e por isso, nos tornamos ainda mais completos.

Então, se você possui alguma deficiência, faz parte do grupo diversidade, ou tem mais de 50 anos, #vemprapanvel

Encantar os clientes no processo de atendimento, prestando auxílio diferenciado e atuando com empatia, divulgando a marca própria e os diferenciais da empresa;
Atuar junto ao cliente no processo de finalização de compra;
Recebimento de valores, realizando abertura e fechamento de caixa;
Auxiliar no processo de recebimento, estocagem e controle de vencimentos de produtos na loja;
Exercer rotinas diárias de guarda, reposição de mercadorias e produtos na loja conforme padrões estabelecidos;
Manter a loja e produtos organizados de acordo com o padrão Panvel;
Prestar apoio em atividades administrativas da loja, quando necessário.

Requisitos e qualificações

Ensino Médio completo;
18 anos ou mais;
Disponibilidade para trabalhar em escala 6x1 (incluindo sábados, domingos e feriados);
Disponibilidade para trabalhar nos turnos Tarde e Noite (fechamento de loja);
Não é necessário experiência, pois somos uma empresa que desenvolve talentos. Experiência será um diferencial.

Informações adicionais

Qual pacote de Benefícios?

Vale Transporte
Vale Alimentação
Assistência Médica Unimed (opção: ambulatorial ou hospitalar)
Associação de Funcionários (Assistência Odontológica + benefícios)
Bônus por Resultado
PLR - Participação nos Lucros e Resultados da empresa
Auxílio Farmácia (desconto de 10% à 40%)
Desconto Gympass
Day Off (Folga Aniversário)
Oportunidade de Crescimento (investimos muito em pessoas e com isso, você terá a possibilidade de assumir novos cargos)

Disponibilidade de início imediato.

Cuidar está na nossa essência. Há mais de 55 anos, começamos a construir uma história que coloca no centro aquilo que mais importa: as pessoas. Seja por meio do varejo, de distribuição ou de nossos produtos e serviços, somos comprometidos a levar, sempre e da melhor forma, saúde e bem-estar aos nossos clientes, colaboradores, investidores e parceiros.

Trabalhamos diariamente para construir uma sociedade e um meio ambiente mais equilibrados, vislumbrando, antes de tudo, o desenvolvimento de um mundo melhor.

Nossa missão: Proporcionar saúde e bem-estar para as pessoas.

Nossa visão: Ser a melhor em produtos e serviços de saúde e bem-estar de forma sustentável e inovadora.

Nossos valores: Ser ético, Trabalhar em equipe, Desenvolver pessoas, Atender com excelência, Ter agilidade e Comprometer-se com o resultado.

O Grupo Panvel é formado por três negócios:

A Panvel Farmácias, maior rede de farmácias do Sul do país, com mais de 600 lojas que comercializam medicamentos e produtos de higiene e beleza. Estamos presentes em diversas cidades do Rio Grande do Sul, Santa Catarina, Paraná e São Paulo.

O Centro de Distribuição (CDs), uma das principais distribuidoras de medicamentos do Brasil e a pioneira do país no seu segmento. Nossos Centros estão localizados em Eldorado do Sul/RS e São José dos Pinhais/PR.

O Laboratório Industrial Farmacêutico Lifar, divisão de desenvolvimento e fabricação de cosméticos, medicamentos e alimentos, que, além de ser responsável pela produção de itens para grandes marcas, também fabrica para a marca própria da Panvel.

Collaborate with leadership to uphold compliance with security standards.

ISO 27001 familiarity.
Azure Cloud (VMs, identity, networking).

Qualifications

Must-Haves:

8–10 years of experience in IT infrastructure, operations, and security.

Advanced English

Microsoft Azure (identity, networking, compliance)
Microsoft Intune for endpoint management

Palo Alto Firewalls and related security policies
Cybersecurity tools like EDR, MFA, PAM, and ZTNA

Azure Security Engineer
Palo Alto PCNSE
CEH (Certified Ethical Hacker) or equivalent

A career with thought leaders who literally wrote the book on Marketplace Best Practices.
A career in the fast-paced world of retail eCommerce, digital marketplaces and platform businesses.

description:
Street Diligence is a high-growth FinTech start-up with an innovative product offering and ambitious expansion plans. Our clients include leading financial institutions that use our platform to analyze and negotiate advantageous terms in legal and financial contracts. We break down key terms, identify what’s “market” and “off-market” and flags risks embedded in contract terms. Our platform also provides unique visuals, benchmarking and comparison to place negotiations and contracts in context. Founded in 2012, Street Diligence is headquartered in New York.

About the Role
We’re looking for a seasoned Engineering Team Lead with a strong web development background, proven leadership skills, and a curiosity-driven mindset to guide our growing team. This is a hybrid player-coach role: you’ll write production-quality code, lead sprint planning and ticket prioritization, and mentor engineers to ship great software — fast and smart.

You’ll report directly to the CTO and play a central role in aligning technical execution with Street Diligence’s broader product vision. If you thrive on solving real-world problems and love building high-performing, mission-aligned teams, we’d love to meet you.

What You’ll Do

Lead an engineering team through the full development cycle — from sprint planning and ticket scoping/assignment to deployment and delivery.

Write and review web-centric production code, especially in Python and JavaScript.

Coach engineers through technical challenges, peer reviews, and architecture decisions.

Own execution: translate product priorities into technical plans and keep the team moving.

Partner with Product and Design to ensure we’re solving the right problems the right way.

Foster a collaborative, curious, and high-accountability engineering culture.

What You’ll Bring to the Table

5+ years of experience in web development and software engineering, with 2+ years in a team lead or management role.

A strong grasp of frontend and backend architecture, with hands-on experience in modern web stacks — our current tech includes Python, JavaScript, MariaDB, Redis, Azure, and Frappe.

Comfort balancing leadership with hands-on coding.

Proven track record of owning sprint planning, backlog grooming, and cross-functional coordination.

A thoughtful, growth-minded approach to mentorship and team development.

Clear, collaborative communication — across both technical and non-technical audiences.

Curiosity, humility, and a drive to learn fast and build well.

Bonus Points For

Experience scaling SaaS platforms or working in high-growth startup environments.

Exposure to Snowflake, SQL optimization, or legal/fintech domains.

Why Street Diligence

You’ll help redefine how some of the world’s biggest investors understand risk.

You’ll work alongside smart, driven teammates who care about building something great.

You’ll have a direct line to leadership and the opportunity to shape our tech and culture as we grow.

We know great candidates may not meet every single requirement — if you’re excited about the role and think you’d be a great fit, we’d love to hear from you.

We know that not everyone will meet all of the qualifications listed above. If your experience doesn't perfectly align, but you believe you'd be a strong fit for the team, we encourage you to apply. We’re eager to learn more about what you can offer!

Street Diligence is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state or local law. At BairesDev®, we've been leading the way in technology projects for over 15 years. We deliver cutting-edge solutions to giants like Google and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley.

Our diverse 4,000+ team, composed of the world's Top 1% of tech talent, works remotely on roles that drive significant impact worldwide.

When you apply for this position, you're taking the first step in a process that goes beyond the ordinary. We aim to align your passions and skills with our vacancies, setting you on a path to exceptional career development and success.

React Frontend Developer at BairesDev

Being a React Frontend Developer in our Development Team is just like being a full-time problem solver. We expect your abilities to be a combination of experience, knowledge, and independence. Innovation is also at the heart of the BairesDev strategy. So, if you were willing to take on the most complex tasks and be a master of your tech stack, React, then you are probably one of those unique we’re looking for.

You will face numerous technical challenges, so you must use current technologies, get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.

What You’ll Do:

- Design practical solutions to solve problems.
- Participate in code reviews, testing.
- Provide the technology for a platform that facilitates monthly requests.
- Work with big data and predictive analytics on a distributed system.
- Collaborate with the developing team, product owners, client services, to innovate and get the tasks done.

Here’s what we are looking for:

- 4+ years of experience in React.
- 4+ years of experience in Front End development with strong skills in Javascript, CSS3 and HTML5.
- 1+ of experience developing Web applications using ReactJS, Flux, Redux, Relay, etc.
- Experience with other Javascript Frameworks such as Angular, Backbone, Marionette.
- Experience using ES2015 (ES6 / ES7).
- Experience with command lines, APIs, and client-side performance.
- Familiar with the concepts of basic programming, data structures, types of variables and idiosyncrasies.
- Advanced English level.

How we make your work (and your life) easier:

100% remote work (from anywhere).
Excellent compensation in USD or your local currency if preferred
Hardware and software setup for you to work from home.
Flexible hours: create your own schedule.
Paid parental leaves, vacations, and national holidays.
Innovative and multicultural work environment: collaborate and learn from the global Top 1% of talent.
Supportive environment with mentorship, promotions, skill development, and diverse growth opportunities.

Join a global team where your unique talents can truly thrive!

AI-Native at every level

Move at founder speed, prototype in hours, and measure in real user outcomes. Slow teams die.

Q1-2025 Shareholder Letter

Q4-2024 Shareholder Letter

Q3-2024 Shareholder Letter

Required:

3+ years of experience building automations and integrations across SaaS platforms.

Proficiency in Python and REST APIs, with hands-on experience designing orchestration logic and workflow automations.

Experience with integration and event-driven platforms (e.g., GitHub Actions, AWS Lambda) for scalable, reusable automation.

Familiarity with configuration-as-code principles and structured data formats (e.g., JSON, YAML, logs, metrics).

Systems-thinking approach—ability to design resilient automations with observability and fault tolerance.

Understanding of secure-by-default design, access control, and audit logging in automated systems.

Strong communication and documentation skills in English, with the ability to work effectively in a remote, async-first environment.

Preferred:

Exposure to metrics pipelines, alerting systems, or dashboards that support automation monitoring.

Experience supporting service workflows such as onboarding, access changes, and compliance automation.

Familiarity with ITSM concepts such as incident, request, and change workflows.

Experience partnering with Security or DevOps teams to align automation with broader system architecture.

Interest in integration architecture, platform engineering, or extensible tooling design.

Design and deliver system-level automations that connect workflows and data across IT & Security SaaS tools.

Develop orchestration logic using APIs, Python, GitHub Actions, and event-driven platforms like AWS Lambda.

Build reusable automation modules to improve consistency, reduce manual effort, and scale IT service delivery.

Implement observability practices—logging, metrics, and event tracing—to support troubleshooting and operational visibility.

Define integration patterns and configuration-as-code standards for repeatable and auditable automation.

Monitor automation health and surface actionable metrics to improve performance and reliability.

Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to convert service requirements into resilient automation architectures.

Contribute to internal libraries, standards, and documentation to scale automation across the environment.

Support the automation you build—investigating issues, responding to escalations, and ensuring ongoing reliability.

100% Remote: Work from anywhere in your home country.

Flexible Time Away: Coordinate with your team for planned time off, keeping our global platform running seamlessly.

Continuous Learning: All-access learning membership for you and your household - 1:1 tutoring, unlimited on-demand classes, and full suite access.

Supercharge with AI: Leverage cutting-edge AI tools to move faster, iterate smarter, and build with intention.

Global Impact, Global Community: Collaborate with a wide network of international contractors and help build a platform that is transforming how millions of people around the world learn.

If you're driven by impact, energized by ownership, and excited to help shape what's next, you'll thrive here. We move fast, think big, and reward those who deliver. This isn't a traditional corporate environment - it's a place to do the most meaningful work of your career.
